title: What are the chances of a zombie apocalypse happening in 30 years or maybe later? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are the chances of a zombie apocalypse happening in 30 years or maybe later? So… after reading all of the other answers I feel that I must begin immediately to prepare for the impending zombie apocalypse…. An interesting retooling of the “I Am Legend” Story with Will Smith portrayed a human created virus as the cause of the change in humans and that it invoked rabies like rage in the host (not a desire to eat living flesh) but simply rage which expressed itself as tearing, gnawing, and shredding those unaffected until they too were affected. An interesting sub plot element of that movie ( not from the original story) but it was scrapped by the studio was that in the end it was disclosed that Will Smith was the infected person and everyone else was trying to stop him…. Think that would have made the movie much better and profoundly different from the version starring either Charlton Heston or Vincent Price. Returning to your question - Dead flesh cannot re- animate! There are no zombies… could a virus be discovered or created that did irrevocable damage to the concept of what it is to be human - Sure. As the ice melts in Antartica, Siberia, or Greenland it could expose a previous unseen pathogen…. That’s that start of a great story tying all our societal fears into one neat bow…. “Melting ice caps release a virus ( perhaps alien to earth) which then spreads like wild fire causing its victims to behave like zombies…. It writes itself, and it is much more plausible than dead flesh coming back to life.”

Thanks for the A2A, Julian Diep. I really like the ZA genre, both for entertainment and for its practical value. I read stories and books, watch the movies and play the games. With all that in mind… “The chances of a zombie apocalypse happening in 30 years or maybe later” is…nonexistent. Zero. Zip. Zilch. Regardless of how much my less than noble self might like the idea of popping a few zombie heads at 400 meters, it’s not going to happen. I think I’ll watch Night of the Living Dead, again.

Not in literal terms of zombies being the deceased come back to life. But if the radical right of the USA continues to do what it is doing in increasing the divide between rich and poor, the USA might erupt into a second civil war, or maybe you might call it a second revolution. It could in many senses be similar to the French Revolution in which an overwhelming majority of extremely poor people rise up against a minuscule minority of unbelievably rich people. With … shall we say … discomfort ensuing for the rich. If that were to happen, there might be many parallels between the USA of say 2030 and some Zombie shows (I am thinking in particular of The Walking Dead) or even France of the 1790s. The difference of course would be that the poor of the USA are intelligent and can reproduce. The future for the rich minority would be much worse than for the living in The Walking Dead. The rich people of the USA would do well to reconsider their social policies.

It's 0%. A deceased body cannot reanimate. Even if a virus were to allow deceased people to walk, they wouldn't have the mental capacity to walk, or maybe even to crawl. And the environment would cause their body to decay and rot or freeze completely solid. There are too many bacteria and insects out there that hasten the decay process to the point where an undead body would succumb to everyday rot in a matter of a week or two (I'm basing this on how long it has taken medium-sized animals on our property to decay away)

The closest we will ver get would be a disease pandemic such as some mutated form of rabies. Something that turns the infected into aggressive mindless monsters. It's very doubtful that it would rise to apocalyptic level in any first world country. Good health infrastructure and a well organized military would solve a localized problem quickly, and a massive travel quarantine would help limit spread. Then you just wait for the disease to burn out.

Do you mean like in the living dead movies? If so NO. If you mean zombie apocalypse as in apocalyptic disaster, Yes We could be faced with a pandemic spreading around the world before it is discovered. How fast could it travel? 550 miles an hour. I think the chances are very good that it will happen. We have no way to control something like that.
Could probably happen one day. Of course, there is the good chance a zombie apocalypse will never happen.
